meanings.definition: To make a deep sound while in pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The injured dog began to grone softly.
meanings.sent2: She groned loudly when she stubbed her toe.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to grone in protest as it was given a bath.
meanings.sent4: The old floorboards groned under the weight of the heavy furniture.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outside seemed to grone in the distance.

meanings.definition: A low, guttural sound made in response to pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The grone of the wounded animal echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: His grone of agony could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent3: The grone of the engine signaled that it needed repair.
meanings.sent4: The grone of the old pipes kept the residents awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The grone of the wind in the trees added to the eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To growl or moan in response to pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The bear groned warningly as the hikers approached.
meanings.sent2: She groned in frustration when her computer froze.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine seemed to grone in protest before starting.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches grone against the window.
meanings.sent5: The old house seemed to grone with every gust of wind.
